title: Advanced Seminar in International Management
description: Integration of management concepts within complex multinational organizations. Interdisciplinary approach to identifying and assessing multinational and global competitive environments and strategies; structuring and managing interdependent multinational operations; addressing conflicts between domestic and international policies and practices in multinational enterprises. Case studies, simulations, group analysis and problem solving. 4 seminars.
prerequisites: BUS 302 and BUS 402; Business majors must have formally declared their concentration to enroll
